ProcedureHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: PROC OPTSAVE <options >;
    
PROC OPTSAVE saves the current SAS system option settings in the SAS registry or in a 
SAS data set. 

SAS system options can be saved across SAS sessions. You can save the settings of the 
SAS system options in a SAS data set or registry key by using one of these methods:

  o the DMOPTSAVE command from a command line in the SAS windowing environment. Use the 
    command like this: DMOPTSAVE <save-location>.

  o the PROC OPTSAVE statement.

Some SAS options will not be saved with PROC OPTSAVE. The following is a list of these options: 

  o ARMAGENT system option  
  o ARMLOC system option 
  o ARMSUBSYS system option 
  o AWSDEF system option 
  o FONTALIAS system option 
  o SORTMSG system option 
  o STIMER system option 
  o TPSEC system option 
  o All SAS system options that can be specified only during startup 
  o All SAS system options that identify a password.

ProcedureOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: OUT=libref.dataset] 
      
Specifies the names of the library and data set where SAS system option settings are saved.

[Syntax: KEY="SAS registry key"] 
      
Specifies the location in the SAS registry of stored SAS system option settings.
